A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
This movie contradicts itself frequently\, and so delivers a message as confusing as its plotholes.

Is self sacrifice a positive thing? For Holdo yes\, but not for Finn.
Is letting the past die a positive thing? Totally... except when for the Jedi order continuing and those pesky holy texts that we destroyed earlier.
Is morality grey? Totally... except when Leia wants to talk about the light.

'Killing the past' mainly seems to involve the abrasive dismantling of core concepts of the old movies. 

Holdo frustrated me.
